com.sap.conn.jco.ext

Interface DestinationDataProvider


  • public interface DestinationDataProvider
    The JCo framework defines the DestinationDataProvider interface to retrieve the destination configuration that must be implemented by infrastructure components. The JCo runtime will use the provided implementation to get the destination configuration that is stored and managed elsewhere and not by the application using the JCo library (separation of concerns). For example, if the destination configuration is stored on an LDAP server, method getDestinationProperties() of the DestinationDataProvider instance needs to get the relevant configuration data from the LDAP server.

    Applications using these destinations (JCoDestination) for executing existing function modules in an ABAP system can rely on the fact, that the destination data is managed elsewhere and the required connection and logon data data is retrieved. It is not the responsibility of the business application logic to manage the destination parameters. A business application may simply use destinations which encapsulate these parameters.

    The example CustomDestinationDataProvider demonstrates a simple implementation of this interface and how to register the instance implementing this interface at the JCo runtime.

    Note:

    • Only one implementation of DestinationDataProvider can be registered. For registering a different implementation the infrastructure has first to unregister the instance that is currently registered. It is not recommended to permanently exchange DestinationDataProvider registrations. The one registered instance should globally manage all destination configurations for the whole infrastructure environment.
    • It is strongly recommended to use a secure persistence layer to store the destination configurations because of the contained authentication data. In particular this means to store at least the credentials in an encrypted way.
    • For security reasons SAP discourages to run so-called extern-to-extern RFC communication scenarios. External or registered RFC server programs are not able to check and authenticate incoming RFC requests from external non-ABAP programs with regard to the pure RFC protocol data. Each of such external RFC calls must be regarded as insecure. Therefore it is highly recommended to always secure such extern-to-extern RFC communications with SNC (Secure Network Communication) or TLS.
    • It is strongly recommended to implement event support. Otherwise configuration changes are not recognized immediately by the JCo runtime so that outdated data might be used. If not supporting events, the data will only be updated if a destination is looked up again via class JCoDestinationManager. Please see the DestinationDataEventListener interface in order to find out more about the reaction of the JCo runtime to destination data events.

    Destination configuration

    In most scenarios the destination configuration will consist of properties from the following groups:

    • user logon properties
    • configuration of the physical connection
    • SNC configuration or TLS configuration
    • destination configuration

    The minimum configuration contains user logon properties and the physical connection configuration, i.e. at least this data must be provided in order to get an operable destination.
    The configuration data can be categorized into the following groups:

    1. Authentication type
      1. Destination with an explicitly configured user
        The configured user will always be used, no matter which user is currently running in the Java context or is logged on at the JCo application.
      2. Destination with the current user
        This may be used in an application server scenario. In this case the current user, who is logged on at the Java application server or is associated to the current Java session context, will be used.

    2. User logon properties
      • User ID or user alias plus password
      • User logon language
      • SSO ticket or X.509 certificate
      • External identification user logon data and type

    3. Configuration of the physical connection
      1. Direct connection to an SAP application server instance
        SAP client, application server host and system number
      2. Load balancing connection to a group of SAP application servers via a message server
        SAP client, message server host and either message server service/port or the SAP system ID plus an optional logon group name of SAP application servers
      3. Direct connection to an SAP application server instance via WebSocket communication
        SAP client, WebSocket server host and WebSocket port
      4. Direct connection to a registered RFC server program
        SAP gateway host and gateway service/port and the registered RFC server program ID
      5. Direct connection to a started RFC server program
        SAP gateway host and gateway service/port, the hostname to start the RFC server program on and the external RFC server executable program name (including the path)

      If the targeted SAP system is behind an SAProuter, an SAProuter string can be used in addition.

    4. SNC configuration
      If secure communication over non-WebSocket connections is desired, an SNC trusted environment between the involved systems and users must have been set up and configured as a prerequisite.
      See the Transport Layer Security on SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP for further details.
      Then the SNC mode must be set to 1 and the SNC partner name needs to be specified, if a direct application server logon is desired. The SNC partner name is not required for load balanced logons for which its value will be retrieved from the SAP message server in this case. In addition, the path to an SNC library must be set either globally via JCo middleware property jco.middleware.snc_lib or as destination property jco.client.snc_lib. Further parameters like the own SNC name or the quality of protection (QOP level) depend on the used SNC library and are optional.
      A short how-to description with using the SAP Common Cryptography Library as the SNC library of choice can be found in KBA 2642538.

    5. Destination pool configuration
      • Maximum number of simultaneous connections that can be created by the destination (peak limit)
      • Maximum number of connections that are kept open for reuse (pool capacity)
      • Connection timeout and check period for closing pooled idle connections (expiration time)
      • Maximum waiting time for getting a free connection, if the pool is temporary exhausted (max. get client time)
      • Further options like checking for corrupt connections in the pool

    6. Repository configuration
      1. The destination itself shall be used for repository meta data queries
        no additional repository configuration needed
      2. A different destination shall be used for repository meta data queries
        repository destination name must be specified
      3. This destination shall be used for repository meta data queries but with a different technical user and password
        repository user and password must be specified, a potentially configured SNC usage can be switched off

    7. TLS configuration (for WebSocket communication only)
      If secure communication over WebSockets is desired, the chosen back-end port must be configured appropriately. Furthermore method getSSLContext(String) has to return a suitable SSLContext with containing the necessary trusts (and optionally the client certificate) for the given destination name. If client certificate logon wants to be performed, getClientCertificate(String) needs to provide the used certificate.
      For the default implementation of the DestinationDataProvider - which is not recommended to be used in productive scenarios - at least the properties JCO_TLS_P12FILE and JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD need to be specified in the destination's property file. Please see the description below for further details.

    The following properties are supported:

    destination authentication information
    jco.destination.auth_typeauthentication type - configured user or current user
    user logon properties
    jco.client.user Logon user ID
    jco.client.alias_user Logon user alias
    jco.client.passwd Logon password
    jco.client.lang Logon language (optional)
    jco.client.mysapsso2 SAP Cookie Version 2 as logon ticket
    jco.client.x509cert X.509 certificate as logon ticket
    jco.client.extid_data External identification user logon data
    jco.client.extid_type Type of the external identification user logon data
    connection configuration
    jco.client.type Connection type (optional)
    jco.client.client SAP client
    jco.client.ashost SAP application server host
    jco.client.sysnr SAP system number
    jco.client.mshost SAP message server host
    jco.client.msserv SAP message server service or port number (optional)
    jco.client.r3name System ID of the SAP system, the so-called SID
    jco.client.group Logon group name of SAP application servers (optional, default is PUBLIC)
    jco.client.tphost Host on which to start an external RFC server executable program
    jco.client.tpname Registered RFC server program ID / External RFC server executable program name
    jco.client.wshost WebSocket host, for example an SAP application server host to be used for WebSocket communication
    jco.client.wsport WebSocket port number to be used for WebSocket communication
    jco.client.proxy_host Host name of the HTTP proxy used for WebSocket communication (optional)
    jco.client.proxy_port Port number of the HTTP proxy used for WebSocket communication (optional)
    jco.client.proxy_user Technical user name for a password protected HTTP proxy if used for WebSocket communication (optional)
    jco.client.proxy_passwdPassword for a password protected HTTP proxy if used for WebSocket communication (optional)
    jco.client.gwhost SAP gateway host
    jco.client.gwserv SAP gateway service or port number
    jco.client.saprouter SAProuter string to use for networks being protected by a firewall
    trace configuration
    jco.client.trace Enable/disable RFC trace (0 - no trace [default] or 1 - enable trace)
    jco.client.cpic_trace Enable/disable CPIC trace (-1 [take over environment value <CPIC_TRACE>], 0: no trace, 1,2,3: different trace levels)
    special optional parameters
    jco.client.lcheck Enable/disable logon check at connection opening time (1 - enable [default] or 0 - disable and postpone)
    jco.client.use_sapgui Start a SAP GUI and attach it to the connection (0 - do not start GUI [default], 1 - start GUI, 2 - start GUI in invisible mode)
    jco.client.codepage Initial logon code page in SAP notation (default: 1100)
    jco.client.pcs Initial logon code page type (1 - non-unicode [default] or 2 - unicode)
    jco.client.delta Enable/disable table parameter delta management (1 - enable [default] or 0 - disable)
    jco.client.getsso2 Get/don't get an SSO ticket after logon (1 - request ticket or 0 - don't request ticket [default])
    jco.client.sticky Enable/disable sticky behavior for logon load balanced destinations (0 - disable [default] or 1 - enable)
    jco.client.use_basxml Enable/disable basXML serialization for transferring function module data (1 - enable [default] or 0 - disable)
    jco.client.network Expected network type to be used by the destination (LAN - fast local area network [default] or WAN - slow wide area network)
    jco.client.serialization_format Serialization format to be used for transferring function module data (rowBased - classic row based serialization [default] or columnBased - new column based serialization)
    jco.client.deny_initial_passwordDeny usage of initial passwords (0 - do not deny [default] or 1 - deny initial passwords)
    destination pool configuration
    jco.destination.peak_limit Maximum number of active connections that can be created for a destination simultaneously
    jco.destination.pool_capacity Maximum number of idle connections kept open by the destination. A value of 0 has the effect that there is no connection pooling, i.e. connections will be closed after each request.
    jco.destination.expiration_time Time in ms after that the connections hold by the internal pool can be closed
    jco.destination.expiration_check_periodInterval in ms with which the timeout checker thread checks the connections in the pool for expiration
    jco.destination.max_get_client_time Maximum time in ms to wait for a free connection, if the maximum allowed number of connections is allocated by the application
    jco.destination.pool_check_connection When set to 1 the pool checks for corrupted connections before they are used by an application. (Default: 0)
    SNC configuration
    jco.client.snc_mode Secure Network Communications (SNC) mode; 1: on, 0: off (default)
    jco.client.snc_partnernameSNC name of the communication partner server. For example: p:CN=SID, O=ACompany, C=EN
    jco.client.snc_qop SNC quality of protection; valid values: 1, 2, 3, 8 (default), 9
    jco.client.snc_myname Own SNC name of the caller (optional). Overrides the default SNC name. For example: p:CN=MyUserID, O=ACompany, C=EN
    jco.client.snc_lib Full path to the library which provides the SNC service; default: value from JCo middleware property jco.middleware.snc_lib
    jco.client.snc_sso Turn on/off the SSO mechanism for SNC. If set to 0 use alternative credentials like user/password instead. Valid values are 1 (yes, default) and 0 (no).
    repository configuration
    jco.destination.repository_destinationSpecifies which destination should be used for repository queries.
    jco.destination.repository.user Optional: If repository destination is not set, and this property is set, it will be used as user for repository queries. This allows using a different user for repository lookups and restrict the permissions accordingly.
    jco.destination.repository.passwd The password for a repository user. Mandatory, if a repository user should be used.
    jco.destination.repository.snc_mode Optional: If SNC is used for this destination, it is possible to turn it off for repository connections, if this property is set to 0. Defaults to the value of jco.client.snc_mode.
    jco.destination.repository_roundtrip_optimizationA value of 1 forces the usage of remote function module RFC_METADATA_GET for meta data queries from ABAP systems, 0 deactivates it. If the property is not set, the destination will initially do a remote call to check whether RFC_METADATA_GET is available. And if it is available, it will use it.
    TLS configuration
    jco.client.use_tls Specifies if the TLS (Transport Layer Security) protocol shall be used for the communication via a WebSocket. (Default=1)
    jco.client.tls_client_certificate_logonSpecifies if the client certificate provided by the SSLContext and getClientCertificate(String) should be used for authentication instead of JCO_USER and JCO_PASSWD. (Default=0)

    The following properties are only used by JCo's destination property file based default implementation, i.e. if no DestinationDataProvider instance is explicitly registered, and JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1:
    jco.client.tls_trust_all Specifies if all TLS entities shall be trusted. If set to 1, the following p12 file properties are ignored. (Default=0)
    jco.client.tls_p12_file Path to a p12 file containing all trusted entities.
    jco.client.tls_p12_passwdPassword for the specified p12 file. The password is mandatory if a p12 file is used.

    Note:

    • Depending on the SAP system release, logins using Single-Sign-On tickets (SSO) or X.509 certificates are supported.
      The logon with X.509 certificates is based on SNC and can only be used in combination with a secure network connection.
    • To resolve the service names sapgwNN, sapgwNNs, or sapmsXXX a lookup in the etc/services file is required. If using port numbers instead of symbolic service names no lookups are performed and no additional entries in etc/services are needed.

    Configuration of destination pool and connection pooling

    Each destination is associated with a connection factory and, if the pooling feature is used, with a connection pool.
    The destination pool is initially empty. The JCo runtime does not preallocate any connection. The first connection will be created if the first call is sent. The property peak_limit describes how many connections can be created simultaneously, if applications allocate connections in different sessions at the same time - either for executing a remote function call or for reserving a connection for a stateful call sequence.
    After peak_limit connections have been allocated (in peak_limit sessions), the next session will wait for maximum max_get_client_time ms until a different session releases a connection either by finishing a stateless remote function call or by ending a stateful call sequence. In case the waiting session does not get any connection during the max_get_client_time waiting period, the current RFC request will be aborted by throwing a JCoException with error group JCO_ERROR_RESOURCE.
    The connections that are no longer used by applications are put back to the internal destination pool. There are at most pool_capacity connections kept open by the pool. Further connections (peak_limit - pool_capacity) will be closed immediately after usage. The pooled connections (idle connections in the pool) are marked as expired if they have not been used for the expiration_time period. Expired connections will be closed by a timeout checker thread which executes such an expiration check every expiration_check_period ms.

      SAP ABAP application server host, mandatory for a direct application server instance connection.

      Authentication type used by the destination.
      static String JCO_AUTH_TYPE_CONFIGURED_USER
      Value to use for the property JCO_AUTH_TYPE.

      Value to use for the property JCO_AUTH_TYPE.
      static String JCO_CLIENT
      SAP client, mandatory logon parameter.
      static String JCO_CODEPAGE
      Additional logon parameter to define the code page that will be used to convert the logon parameters.
      static String JCO_CPIC_TRACE
      Enable/disable CPIC trace [0..3].
      static String JCO_DELTA
      Use the table delta management for reducing the amount of data being sent via the network, especially if dealing with big RFC table parameters.
      static String JCO_DENY_INITIAL_PASSWORD
      If set to 1, using initial passwords will lead to an exception.
      static String JCO_DEST
      Deprecated. 
      Will be removed in future versions without further notice.
      static String JCO_EXPIRATION_PERIOD
      Time period in ms after which the destination checks released connections for their expiration.
      static String JCO_EXPIRATION_TIME
      Time in ms after which free connections, which are held internally by the destination, can be closed.
      static String JCO_EXTID_DATA
      External identification user logon data.
      static String JCO_EXTID_TYPE
      Type of the external identification user logon data.
      static String JCO_GETSSO2
      Request an SSO ticket from the SAP system.
      static String JCO_GROUP
      Logon group of the logon load balanced connections, which is identifying a set of SAP application servers (optional; default is PUBLIC).
      static String JCO_GWHOST
      SAP gateway host to use for the connection.
      static String JCO_GWSERV
      SAP gateway service or port number.
      static String JCO_LANG
      Logon language, if not defined the default user language is used.
      static String JCO_LCHECK
      Defines whether the user authentication and RFC authorization check shall be done directly at logon.
      static String JCO_MAX_GET_TIME
      Maximum time in ms to wait for a free connection, if the maximum allowed number of connections is currently in use by the application.
      static String JCO_MSHOST
      SAP message server host, mandatory for a logon load balanced connection.
      static String JCO_MSSERV
      SAP message server service name or port number.
      static String JCO_MYSAPSSO2
      SAP Cookie version 2 as logon ticket for SSO based authentication.
      static String JCO_NETWORK
      Defines which network type is expected to be used by the destination.
      static String JCO_PASSWD
      Logon password, logon parameter for password based authentication.
      static String JCO_PCS
      Additional logon parameter to define the code page type of the SAP system.
      static String JCO_PEAK_LIMIT
      Maximum number of active connections that can be created for a destination simultaneously.
      static String JCO_PING_CHECK_INTERVAL
      Interval in seconds how often a WebSocket connection, which is currently not writing/reading any data, is checked for incoming ping messages and a response (pong) is sent accordingly right after that.
      static String JCO_POOL_CAPACITY
      Maximum number of idle connections kept open by the destination.
      static String JCO_POOL_CHECK_CONNECTION
      When setting this value to 1, a pooled connection will be checked for corruption before being used for the next function module execution.
      static String JCO_PROXY_HOST
      Host name of the network proxy to be used.
      static String JCO_PROXY_PASSWD
      Password for authenticating at the network proxy.
      static String JCO_PROXY_PORT
      Port number of the network proxy to be used.
      static String JCO_PROXY_USER
      Technical user name for authenticating at the network proxy.
      static String JCO_R3NAME
      System ID of the SAP system, the so-called SID.
      static String JCO_REPOSITORY_DEST
      Specifies which other destination shall be used for creating the repository and retrieving meta data.
      static String JCO_REPOSITORY_PASSWD
      The password for a repository user.
      static String JCO_REPOSITORY_ROUNDTRIP_OPTIMIZATION
      Enable the usage of the RFC_METADATA_GET API, which is providing repository meta data in one single network roundtrip.
      static String JCO_REPOSITORY_SNC
      Optional: If SNC is used for this destination, it is possible to turn it off for repository connections, if this property is set to 0.
      static String JCO_REPOSITORY_USER
      If a repository destination is not set and this property is set, it will be used as user for repository calls.
      static String JCO_SAPROUTER
      SAProuter string for connections to systems behind an SAProuter.
      static String JCO_SERIALIZATION_FORMAT
      Defines the serialization format that is used for transferring function module data to the partner system.
      static String JCO_SNC_LIBRARY
      Path to the library which provides the SNC service.
      static String JCO_SNC_MODE
      Secure Network Communications (SNC) mode.
      static String JCO_SNC_MYNAME
      Own SNC name of the caller.
      static String JCO_SNC_PARTNERNAME
      SNC name of the communication partner server.
      static String JCO_SNC_QOP
      SNC quality of protection.
      static String JCO_SNC_SSO
      When connecting via SNC, the SNC identity is typically used for authenticating the caller.
      static String JCO_STICKY_ASHOST
      Optional property for a logon load balanced destination configuration (default is 0).
      static String JCO_SYSNR
      System number of the SAP ABAP application server, mandatory for a direct application server instance connection.
      static String JCO_TLS_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_LOGON
      If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 this property enables the logon at the backend via the x509 client certificate that is used in the TLS handshake.
      static String JCO_TLS_P12FILE
      If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default DestinationDataProvider implementation is used, this property contains the full path to the p12 file containing all trusted entities.
      static String JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD
      If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default DestinationDataProvider implementation is used, this property contains the mandatory password for the p12 file which is specified via JCO_TLS_P12FILE.
      static String JCO_TLS_TRUST_ALL
      If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default DestinationDataProvider implementation is used, this property steers if all TLS entities shall be trusted.
      static String JCO_TPHOST
      Host on which to start an external RFC server executable program.
      static String JCO_TPNAME
      Registered RFC server program ID or - if used in combination with {link JCO_TPHOST} - the external RFC server executable program name to start (including the path).
      static String JCO_TRACE
      RFC trace flag.
      static String JCO_TYPE
      The connection type.
      static String JCO_USE_BASXML
      Defines whether basXML shall be used for serializing function module data, if the meta data shows that the the function module is basXML enabled.
      static String JCO_USE_SAPGUI
      Specifies to use a SAP GUI.
      static String JCO_USE_TLS
      Specifies if the TLS (Transport Layer Security) protocol shall be used for protecting the communication via a WebSocket.
      static String JCO_USER
      Logon user ID, logon parameter for password based authentication.
      static String JCO_WSHOST
      WebSocket host to be used for direct WebSocket communication.
      static String JCO_WSPORT
      WebSocket port number to be used for direct WebSocket communication.
      static String JCO_X509CERT
      X.509 certificate for certificate based authentication.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default X509Certificate getClientCertificate(String destinationName)
      This method is invoked by the JCo runtime if JCO_TLS_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_LOGON is set in order to get the client certificate which will be used in the user logon at the backend when WebSocket communication is established.
      Properties getDestinationProperties(String destinationName)
      This method shall return a properties object that contains a subset of the supported properties mentioned above which represent the configuration of the given destination in your destination configuration repository.
      default SSLContext getSSLContext(String destinationName)
      This method is invoked by the JCo runtime in order to get a SSLContext which is then used to establish a secure connection in case that a WebSocket communication shall be established.
      void setDestinationDataEventListener(DestinationDataEventListener eventListener)
      This method sets a DestinationDataEventListener implemented by JCo that processes the fired events within the JCo runtime.
      boolean supportsEvents()
      Returns true if the implementation can support DestinationDataEvents that allow a better integration into the JCo runtime management.

    • Field Detail

      • JCO_AUTH_TYPE

        static final String JCO_AUTH_TYPE
        Authentication type used by the destination. Valid types are:
        • CONFIGURED_USER - the destination is configured for one specific user only. All connections opened via this destination will use the same configured user.
        • CURRENT_USER - the destination will dynamically use the identity of the user who is currently signed on to the active application server session.

        Note: This property is optional, the default value is CONFIGURED_USER.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_AUTH_TYPE_CONFIGURED_USER

        static final String JCO_AUTH_TYPE_CONFIGURED_USER
        Value to use for the property JCO_AUTH_TYPE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final String JCO_AUTH_TYPE_CURRENT_USER
        Value to use for the property JCO_AUTH_TYPE.
        See Also:

        static final String JCO_CLIENT
        SAP client, mandatory logon parameter.

        static final String JCO_USER
        Logon user ID, logon parameter for password based authentication.
        See Also:

      • JCO_ALIAS_USER

        static final String JCO_ALIAS_USER
        Logon user alias, can be used instead of the logon user ID.

        static final String JCO_PASSWD
        Logon password, logon parameter for password based authentication.

      • JCO_LANG

        static final String JCO_LANG
        Logon language, if not defined the default user language is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_CODEPAGE

        static final String JCO_CODEPAGE
        Additional logon parameter to define the code page that will be used to convert the logon parameters. The default code page is 1100. Use in special cases only.

        Note: This is not the code page to be used for the RFC communication. The RFC communication code page is selected by the target SAP system and is always Unicode for Unicode SAP systems, otherwise it depends on the used logon language.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PCS

        static final String JCO_PCS
        Additional logon parameter to define the code page type of the SAP system.
        1 - non-Unicode, 2 - Unicode enabled. Use in special cases only.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_ASHOST

        static final String JCO_ASHOST
        SAP ABAP application server host, mandatory for a direct application server instance connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SYSNR

        static final String JCO_SYSNR
        System number of the SAP ABAP application server, mandatory for a direct application server instance connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MSHOST

        static final String JCO_MSHOST
        SAP message server host, mandatory for a logon load balanced connection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MSSERV

        static final String JCO_MSSERV
        SAP message server service name or port number. For logon load balanced connections either the SAP message server service or the SAP system ID needs to be specified. In order to resolve the service name sapms<SID> a lookup in etc/services is performed by the network layer of the operating system. If using port numbers instead of symbolic service names, no lookups are performed and no additional entries are needed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_R3NAME

        static final String JCO_R3NAME
        System ID of the SAP system, the so-called SID. For logon load balanced connections either the SAP system ID or the SAP message server service needs to be specified. If no SAP message server service is specified, sapms<SID> will be automatically set as service name, which needs to be resolved by the network layer of the operating system.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_GROUP

        static final String JCO_GROUP
        Logon group of the logon load balanced connections, which is identifying a set of SAP application servers (optional; default is PUBLIC).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_STICKY_ASHOST

        static final String JCO_STICKY_ASHOST
        Optional property for a logon load balanced destination configuration (default is 0). If set to 1, a destination configured for logon load balancing behaves like a destination that is configured to use a concrete application server. This means once a connection has been opened to an application server, all following connections using this destination will also be directed the same initially selected application server.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SAPROUTER

        static final String JCO_SAPROUTER
        SAProuter string for connections to systems behind an SAProuter. The SAProuter string contains the chain of SAProuters and its port numbers and has the form:
          (/H/<host>[/S/<port>])+
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MYSAPSSO2

        static final String JCO_MYSAPSSO2
        SAP Cookie version 2 as logon ticket for SSO based authentication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_GETSSO2

        static final String JCO_GETSSO2
        Request an SSO ticket from the SAP system. The issued ticket can be obtained from the destination attributes after logon.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_X509CERT

        static final String JCO_X509CERT
        X.509 certificate for certificate based authentication.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_EXTID_DATA

        static final String JCO_EXTID_DATA
        External identification user logon data. Use in conjunction with JCO_EXTID_TYPE. Its format depends on the external ID type. The mapping to the actual logon user has to be defined in the AS ABAP system table VUSREXTID.
        Note: This is an old logon mechanism and should no longer be used.
        Since:
        JCo 3.0.9
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_EXTID_TYPE

        static final String JCO_EXTID_TYPE
        Type of the external identification user logon data. Use in conjunction with JCO_EXTID_DATA. Possible values are for example "NT" for an NT Domain User (NTLM), "MP" for a Microsoft .NET Passport UID (PUID), "ID" for ID data from a trusted RFC system, or "DN" for a Distinguished Name (DN) of a Certificate (X.500).
        Note: This is an old logon mechanism and should no longer be used.
        Since:
        JCo 3.0.9
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_LCHECK

        static final String JCO_LCHECK
        Defines whether the user authentication and RFC authorization check shall be done directly at logon. Setting this property to 0 disables the logon check which means to postpone the user authentication and RFC authorization check until the first remote function call is done. Default is 1 for doing an immediate logon check.
        Note: If not really needed, it is not recommended to postpone the logon check. Use this option only in special cases.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_USE_BASXML

        static final String JCO_USE_BASXML
        Defines whether basXML shall be used for serializing function module data, if the meta data shows that the the function module is basXML enabled. Setting the property to 0 will enforce to never use basXML for serialization, whereas a value of 1 means that the function module meta data will define the behavior. Default is 1.
        Note: This property is ignored, if JCO_SERIALIZATION_FORMAT is set to columnBased.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_NETWORK

        static final String JCO_NETWORK
        Defines which network type is expected to be used by the destination. The property will influence the behavior for serializing function module data. Valid values are LAN for a fast local area network and WAN for a slow wide area network. Default is LAN.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SERIALIZATION_FORMAT

        static final String JCO_SERIALIZATION_FORMAT
        Defines the serialization format that is used for transferring function module data to the partner system. Valid values are columnBased and rowBased. When specifying the value columnBased, the fast column-based RFC serialization will be used if the communication partner system is supporting this format as well. When specifying the value rowBased, the classic or basXML serialization will be used. Default is rowBased.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_DELTA

        static final String JCO_DELTA
        Use the table delta management for reducing the amount of data being sent via the network, especially if dealing with big RFC table parameters. The default value is 1 and enables the feature, which means that only appended/deleted/updated table rows are transferred back to the caller. A value of 0 disables the feature and means that always the whole table parameter is sent back. This destination property is only relevant if the 'jco.delta_management' RFC protocol feature is not generally switched off. Use in special cases only.
        See Also:
        JCo.setProperty(String, String), Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_PARTNERNAME

        static final String JCO_SNC_PARTNERNAME
        SNC name of the communication partner server.
        For example: p:CN=SID, O=ACompany, C=EN
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_QOP

        static final String JCO_SNC_QOP
        SNC quality of protection.
        Valid values:
            1: Authentication only
            2: Authentication and integrity protection
            3: Authentication, integrity and privacy protection (encryption)
            8: Global default configuration (usually equivalent to value 3)
            9: Maximum protection
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_MYNAME

        static final String JCO_SNC_MYNAME
        Own SNC name of the caller. Overrides the default SNC name.
        For example: p:CN=MyUserID, O=ACompany, C=EN
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_MODE

        static final String JCO_SNC_MODE
        Secure Network Communications (SNC) mode. Valid values are 1: on, 0: off (default)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_SSO

        static final String JCO_SNC_SSO
        When connecting via SNC, the SNC identity is typically used for authenticating the caller. If it is required to override this default behavior, then this property can be set to 0, so that user/password or other user identity information can be used for authenticating the caller, but the line may still be encrypted if using the privacy protection feature of SNC. The default value is 1, which means to make use of the SSO behavior for SNC.
        Since:
        JCo 3.0.9
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_LIBRARY

        static final String JCO_SNC_LIBRARY
        Path to the library which provides the SNC service.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_DEST

        @Deprecated
static final String JCO_DEST
        Deprecated. Will be removed in future versions without further notice.
        For internal purposes only.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PEAK_LIMIT

        static final String JCO_PEAK_LIMIT
        Maximum number of active connections that can be created for a destination simultaneously. A value of 0 allows an unlimited number of active connections, otherwise if the value is less than the value of jco.destination.pool_capacity, it will be automatically increased to this value. Default setting is the value of jco.destination.pool_capacity, or in case of jco.destination.pool_capacity not being specified as well, the default is 0 (unlimited).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_POOL_CAPACITY

        static final String JCO_POOL_CAPACITY
        Maximum number of idle connections kept open by the destination. A value of 0 has the effect that there is no connection pooling. Default is 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_EXPIRATION_TIME

        static final String JCO_EXPIRATION_TIME
        Time in ms after which free connections, which are held internally by the destination, can be closed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_EXPIRATION_PERIOD

        static final String JCO_EXPIRATION_PERIOD
        Time period in ms after which the destination checks released connections for their expiration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MAX_GET_TIME

        static final String JCO_MAX_GET_TIME
        Maximum time in ms to wait for a free connection, if the maximum allowed number of connections is currently in use by the application.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_POOL_CHECK_CONNECTION

        static final String JCO_POOL_CHECK_CONNECTION
        When setting this value to 1, a pooled connection will be checked for corruption before being used for the next function module execution. Thus, it is possible to recognize broken connections and avoid that an exception will be thrown to the application, if the network connectivity is working in principle but only single pooled connections are corrupted. Default is 0.

        Note: Switching on this check has a negative impact on the performance for stateless communications. This is due to an additional low level ping to the communication partner, which is taking a certain amount of time for working connections depending on the network latency and the system load of the target system.

        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REPOSITORY_DEST

        static final String JCO_REPOSITORY_DEST
        Specifies which other destination shall be used for creating the repository and retrieving meta data.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REPOSITORY_USER

        static final String JCO_REPOSITORY_USER
        If a repository destination is not set and this property is set, it will be used as user for repository calls. This allows using a different user for repository lookups.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REPOSITORY_PASSWD

        static final String JCO_REPOSITORY_PASSWD
        The password for a repository user. Mandatory, if a repository user shall be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REPOSITORY_SNC

        static final String JCO_REPOSITORY_SNC
        Optional: If SNC is used for this destination, it is possible to turn it off for repository connections, if this property is set to 0. Default setting is the value of jco.client.snc_mode. For special cases only.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_CPIC_TRACE

        static final String JCO_CPIC_TRACE
        Enable/disable CPIC trace [0..3].
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TRACE

        static final String JCO_TRACE
        RFC trace flag. Valid values are 1: enabled, 0: disabled (default)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_GWHOST

        static final String JCO_GWHOST
        SAP gateway host to use for the connection. If not specified, the gateway on the application server host is used by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_GWSERV

        static final String JCO_GWSERV
        SAP gateway service or port number. This property should be specified when using JCO_GWHOST. If not specified, the port of the gateway on the application server is used. In order to resolve the service names sapgw<NN> or sapgw<NN>s a lookup in etc/services is performed by the network layer of the operating system. If using port numbers instead of symbolic service names, no lookups are performed and no additional entries in the network services file are needed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TPHOST

        static final String JCO_TPHOST
        Host on which to start an external RFC server executable program.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TPNAME

        static final String JCO_TPNAME
        Registered RFC server program ID or - if used in combination with {link JCO_TPHOST} - the external RFC server executable program name to start (including the path).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_WSHOST

        static final String JCO_WSHOST
        WebSocket host to be used for direct WebSocket communication. If this is used, then JCO_WSPORT must be specified as well.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_WSPORT

        static final String JCO_WSPORT
        WebSocket port number to be used for direct WebSocket communication. If this is used, then JCO_WSHOST must be specified as well.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_USE_TLS

        static final String JCO_USE_TLS
        Specifies if the TLS (Transport Layer Security) protocol shall be used for protecting the communication via a WebSocket. This property is only relevant if JCO_WSHOST and JCO_WSPORT are specified. This should be set to 0 only for debugging and development purposes.
        Default is 1.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_TRUST_ALL

        static final String JCO_TLS_TRUST_ALL
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default DestinationDataProvider implementation is used, this property steers if all TLS entities shall be trusted. If set to 1, the properties JCO_TLS_P12FILE and JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD are ignored. Default is 0.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_P12FILE

        static final String JCO_TLS_P12FILE
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default DestinationDataProvider implementation is used, this property contains the full path to the p12 file containing all trusted entities. The property is ignored, if JCO_TLS_TRUST_ALL is set to 1.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD

        static final String JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default DestinationDataProvider implementation is used, this property contains the mandatory password for the p12 file which is specified via JCO_TLS_P12FILE. The password is mandatory if a p12 file is used. The property is ignored, if JCO_TLS_TRUST_ALL is set to 1.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_LOGON

        static final String JCO_TLS_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_LOGON
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 this property enables the logon at the backend via the x509 client certificate that is used in the TLS handshake. An according user or rule has to be defined at the backend. Any properties for basic authentication are ignored. Default is 0. getClientCertificate(String) must return the certificate which is going to be used.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PROXY_HOST

        static final String JCO_PROXY_HOST
        Host name of the network proxy to be used. All network traffic for WebSocket communication will be routed through the HTTP proxy running on this host. This property is optional and only needs to be specified if a proxy shall be used. In this case JCO_PROXY_PORT must be specified as well.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PROXY_PORT

        static final String JCO_PROXY_PORT
        Port number of the network proxy to be used. All network traffic for WebSocket communication will be routed through the HTTP proxy listening to this TCP port. This property is optional and only needs to be specified if a proxy shall be used. In this case JCO_PROXY_HOST must be specified as well.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PROXY_USER

        static final String JCO_PROXY_USER
        Technical user name for authenticating at the network proxy. This property is optional and only needed if a network proxy is configured via JCO_PROXY_HOST and requires authentication. In this case JCO_PROXY_PASSWD must be specified as well.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PROXY_PASSWD

        static final String JCO_PROXY_PASSWD
        Password for authenticating at the network proxy. This property is optional and only needed if a network proxy is configured via JCO_PROXY_HOST and requires authentication. In this case JCO_PROXY_USER must be specified as well.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PING_CHECK_INTERVAL

        static final String JCO_PING_CHECK_INTERVAL
        Interval in seconds how often a WebSocket connection, which is currently not writing/reading any data, is checked for incoming ping messages and a response (pong) is sent accordingly right after that. Default is 90 seconds.This property can be also managed globally for all destinations with JCo.setProperty(String, String) and jco.ws.ping_check_interval.
        Note: If your communication partner is an ABAP system, this value needs to be lower than profile parameter icm/WS/ping_interval.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TYPE

        static final String JCO_TYPE
        The connection type. Should not be specified and will be determined and set automatically according to the other specified logon properties.
        Valid values:
          3 - ABAP system with unspecified logon method
          A - ABAP system with direct application server host logon
          B - ABAP system with message server driven load balanced logon
          E - External RFC server program
          R - Registered RFC server program
          W - ABAP system or RFC server program with WebSocket connection
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_USE_SAPGUI

        static final String JCO_USE_SAPGUI
        Specifies to use a SAP GUI. The default SAP GUI will be started and attached to each new RFC connection being opened. It is strongly recommended to use this option only if really needed for executing specific ABAP Remote Function Modules which require an output to a GUI. The development and usage of such ABAP RFMs should usually be avoided. Default is 0.
        Valid values:
            0: do not use a SAP GUI (default)
            1: start the SAP GUI with permanent visibility
            2: start the SAP GUI in invisible mode and only show it when the ABAP system outputs a GUI screen, status message or dialog box window

        Note: Prerequisite for using this special logon option is that a SAP GUI must be installed on the same host where the JCo library is running and the JCo process is also allowed by the operating system to start UI processes or interactive services.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_DENY_INITIAL_PASSWORD

        static final String JCO_DENY_INITIAL_PASSWORD
        If set to 1, using initial passwords will lead to an exception. Default is 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REPOSITORY_ROUNDTRIP_OPTIMIZATION

        static final String JCO_REPOSITORY_ROUNDTRIP_OPTIMIZATION
        Enable the usage of the RFC_METADATA_GET API, which is providing repository meta data in one single network roundtrip.

        A value of 1 forces the usage of RFC_METADATA_GET in the ABAP system, 0 deactivates it. If the property is not set, the destination will initially do a remote call to check whether the function module RFC_METADATA_GET is available. And if it is available, it will use it.

        Note: If a repository is already initialized, for example because it is used by some other destination, this property does not have any effect on this repository anymore. Generally, this property is related to the ABAP system and should have the same value on all destinations targeting the same ABAP system. See note 1456826 for the SAP AS ABAP system prerequisites.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getDestinationProperties

        Properties getDestinationProperties(String destinationName)
                             throws DataProviderException
        This method shall return a properties object that contains a subset of the supported properties mentioned above which represent the configuration of the given destination in your destination configuration repository. Returning null means that the destination is not available. In this case a JCoException with the key JCO_ERROR_RESOURCE will be thrown.

        The implementation may throw a DataProviderException in order to signal an internal error like a severe technical issue that prevent returning the requested properties data. As a consequence the method JCoDestinationManager.getDestination() will then throw a JCoException with an appropriate key to the JCo application.

        Note: Missing user data or user credentials in the destination configuration shall not be regarded as a configuration error and must not result in throwing a DataProviderException because this data may also be set later programmatically by using a JCoCustomDestination.

        Optional: If the DestinationDataProvider shall support the CURRENT_USER authentication type, its implementation must return a custom subclassed java.util.Properties instance for such a configuration. This java.util.Properties implementation needs to interact with the runtime environment and always has to return consistent user logon properties of the currently signed on user dynamically, for example based on the respective application server session or on any other infrastructure specific runtime context.

        Parameters:
        destinationName - The name of the destination for which the provider should return the properties.
        Returns:
        Properties for the destination or null if the destination configuration was not found.
        Throws:
        DataProviderException - if an internal error occurred or a severe configuration error was detected.

      • supportsEvents

        boolean supportsEvents()
        Returns true if the implementation can support DestinationDataEvents that allow a better integration into the JCo runtime management. If the implementation cannot support events it must return false. If you are not sure about the ability that your DestinationDataProvider can guarantee to fire all events, you may return false to be on the safe side.

        If the implementation can support DestinationDataEvents, the JCo runtime will set a DestinationDataEventListener instance which is implemented by JCo.

        Returns:
        whether the implementation fully supports DestinationDataEvents or not.
        See Also:
        setDestinationDataEventListener(DestinationDataEventListener)

      • setDestinationDataEventListener

        void setDestinationDataEventListener(DestinationDataEventListener eventListener)
        This method sets a DestinationDataEventListener implemented by JCo that processes the fired events within the JCo runtime.
        The JCo runtime will register only a single DestinationDataEventListener instance.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - the DestinationDataEventListener to which configuration events need to be fired.

      • getSSLContext

        default SSLContext getSSLContext(String destinationName)
                          throws DataProviderException
        This method is invoked by the JCo runtime in order to get a SSLContext which is then used to establish a secure connection in case that a WebSocket communication shall be established. If you want to use WebSocket connections, please override this method in your implementation accordingly.
        Parameters:
        destinationName - the name of the destination for which the provider should return the SSLContext instance.
        Returns:
        the SSLContext which will be used for setting up a connection.
        Throws:
        DataProviderException
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0

      • getClientCertificate

        default X509Certificate getClientCertificate(String destinationName)
                                      throws DataProviderException
        This method is invoked by the JCo runtime if JCO_TLS_CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_LOGON is set in order to get the client certificate which will be used in the user logon at the backend when WebSocket communication is established. The certificate has to be the one provided in the SSLContext, which is used for the TLS handshake. If you want to logon with the client certificate when WebSocket connections are used, please override this method in your implementation accordingly.
        Parameters:
        destinationName - the name of the destination for which the provider should return the X509Certificate instance.
        Returns:
        the X509Certificate which will be used for the logon.
        Throws:
        DataProviderException
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
